thread.title: Runway sinkhole causes delays at Greek airport
thread.title_full: Runway sinkhole causes delays at Greek airport

title: Runway sinkhole causes delays at Greek airport
text:
Runway sinkhole causes delays at Greek airport Last updated 09:03, September 24 2015 Twitter 
Travellers queued as delays dragged on. 
Passengers were stranded at a Greek airport after it was temporarily shut down after a large sinkhole opened up on its runway. 
Rhodes International Airport in Greece was closed for 14 hours on Tuesday (local time) as contractors repaired the eight-metre sink hole, Mashable reported. 
A spokesperson for Thomson Airways, one of the airlines affected by the closure, said the runway was repaired and had reopened. 
The sinkhole that caused delays at Rhodes International Airport. 
The sinkhole was caused by a crack on the tarmac that had been repaired but reopened after torrential rain. 
The delay meant some passengers were stranded for up to 24 hours.
